body:
### Rationale

During a build, spack provides summary of the build times, like:

```
==> Successfully installed cmake
  Fetch: 1.18s.  Build: 58.42s.  Total: 59.60s.
```
It would be great if these times were also stored along with other info (spack-build-env.txt spack-build-out.txt	spec.yaml) that is kept in the  special `.spack` dir created during the install.

This would allow folks to traverse the builds and extract this info easily after the fact.

### General information

~~- [ ] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack~~
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: keep package build times as part of metadata in .spack dir
